programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: A cybernetic mutant appears seeking revenge on the Mutant X team, and uses his abilities to circumvent the Sanctuary security system. Sci-fi drama, with guest star David Orth

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Troi, Riker and Dr Crusher fall into mysterious comas while the Enterprise plays host to an alien race of historians who conduct research by probing their subjects' memories. Sci-fi drama, starring Jonathan Frakes, Gates McFadden and Marina Sirtis

programme.title: Air Collision (2012)
programme.desc: A massive solar storm has locked the US president's plane into a head-on collision course with a commercial jetliner. Can a flight attendant and a resourceful air traffic controller prevent disaster? Action drama starring Reginald VelJohnson and Jordan Ladd

programme.title: Doctor Who and the Daleks (1965)
programme.desc: The eccentric time-traveller journeys to the Daleks' home world, which has been devastated by their nuclear weapons. He enters their city and finds them engaged in a plot to exterminate their peaceful humanoid enemies the Thals. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Roy Castle, Jennie Linden and Roberta Tovey

programme.title: Murder by Decree (1978)
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes tries to put a stop to Jack the Ripper's campaign of murder. However, he finds Scotland Yard is less supportive of his investigations than in the past, and comes to realise there are people in positions of power who wish the killings to be allowed to continue. Mystery, starring Christopher Plummer, James Mason, Donald Sutherland, John Gielgud and Genevieve Bujold

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk's mission to rescue an old flame leaves him prone to inexplicable fits of rage - and almost provokes a mutiny aboard the good ship Enterprise. Sci-fi drama, starring William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Airwolf

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Part two. Hayes Cooper joins the ranks of the Texas Rangers when he sets out to avenge the deaths of his friends. Starring Chuck Norris

programme.title: Red (2008)
programme.desc: Elderly, reclusive widower Avery Ludlow is left distraught when his only companion in life - a 14-year-old dog named Red - is murdered by three teenagers. After tracking the youths down, Avery demands the parents take action against the youths but after being turned away, he decides to dish out justice by any means necessary. Thriller, starring Brian Cox, Noel Fisher, Tom Sizemore and Kyle Gallner

programme.title: Cult of Chucky (2017)
programme.desc: The killer doll from Child's Play returns to terrorise his human victim, Nica, and has scores to settle with his old enemies. Horror thriller, starring Fiona Dourif, Allison Dawn Doiron and Alex Vincent, with Brad Dourif as the voice of Chucky

programme.title: Killer Mermaids (2014)
programme.desc: Two American girls on holiday in Montenegro meet up with an old friend who offers to show them around an abandoned military base. Unfortunately, the site is also the home of a terrifying aquatic creature with a taste for human flesh. Serbian horror, starring Kristina Klebe, Franco Nero and Natalie Burn

programme.title: The Taking of Deborah Logan (2014)
programme.desc: Deborah, an elderly woman with an aggressive form of Alzheimer's disease, reluctantly agrees to allow a team of film-makers to document her condition. However, when Deborah begins to exhibit behaviours unusual even for someone with her illness, the crew begins to suspect something much more sinister is happening to their subject. Found-footage horror thriller, starring Jill Larson

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Zack agree to talk about their issues. Meanwhile, Denise and Jack find themselves in a tough situation on family games night. Stacey is relieved to have the cash to pay off the loan shark but when they demand more on short notice she has a tough decision to make

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a painting belonging to a Ukrainian family who risked everything to conserve their family history, and a 1963 calendar from Liverpool's Cavern Club that was used to book The Beatles. Also brought into the shop is an 18ft homemade kayak and a leather swivel chair that evokes precious memories of a beloved father and grandfather

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. Their skill, ingenuity and determination are put to the test as they embark on their journey without access to smartphones, the internet or credit cards. Armed with only the cash equivalent of the airfare to fly their route, the teams travel at ground level through some of the most remote regions in the world

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim is invited to parliament to take part in a Select Committee for the new disability funding act, but when Lily shows up and gets him thrown out, he swears revenge. Idris' mum visits to keep an eye on his new business venture but she turns out to be an alt-right conspiracy theorist who sets out on a crusade to turn his bookshop into a temple of bigotry

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Lily's latest scam is at risk when Tim runs into his nemesis Kiefer. Idris is roped into keeping the scam alive but is slowly broken down by Aaliyah's doom and Ruth's insults leading him to embrace the darkness. Can Tim save the day?

programme.title: Live NBA
programme.desc: Dallas Mavericks v Golden State Warriors (Tip-off 11.30pm). Coverage of the Western Conference clash at American Airlines Centre

programme.desc: A police officer uses his first aid skills to help save the life of a woman stabbed in Coventry. Meanwhile, in Greater Manchester, a specialist task force reveals how it tackles crime. Plus, a look at what it takes to become a police horse in the Avon & Somerset Mounted Section

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Birmingham, Dion Dublin struggles to find the promised potential in a three-bedroom end-of-terrace - until he discovers a huge surprise outside. Martel Maxwell is in Warrington, Cheshire, looking around the bare and broken shell of a cottage in need of complete renovation. Plus, cameras return to the Staffordshire countryside to see how things turned out for a young couple renovating a two-bedroom cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Oswestry Showground in Shropshire, with experts Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper. Before the reds and blues' chosen items go under the hammer, Charles Hanson auctions off a rare Chinese treasure that was discovered inside a carrier bag on its way to a charity shop

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel gets exciting news from an old friend, but discovers something unpleasant in the process. Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: An old trunk is turned into a cocktail cabinet, Diarmuid Gavin creates a garden retreat complete with firepit, and a 50p charity shop cup makes an extraordinary return at auction

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is in rural Herefordshire with a couple who want to escape life from under Stansted's flight path and invest their £600,000 in a country home with space for a beloved car and a large coffee table. Jonnie also drops in on the Hay Festival and finds out what attracts a worldwide audience to this quiet Welsh borders area every year

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell tour Co Durham, where after three defeats Phil is desperate to secure a win. He tries to shape up by pumping iron in the form of a water feature, while Irita goes clubbing - Edwardian-style. Phil also has a bash at organ restoration and Irita takes a trip back to the heyday of British seaside holidays at Whitley Bay's Spanish City

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Bob, Andrew, Frank and Fiona compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things get worse for Jack and Denise and Stacey turns to Alfie for help with her financial situation. Rocky is rattled when Kathy finds a wedding dress and Patrick announces he's going to win back Yolande

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A wizard-inspired pair think magical drinks and mini golf will cast a spell over Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A nervous entrepreneur promotes an all-natural supplement that promises glowing skin from within, while there's a sweet pitch from chocolate-makers who have apparently spotted a gap in the market. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The finalists take on their last challenge to win a £250,000 investment, with contestants ejected earlier in the series returning to aid them in their endeavours. The last two must launch their business, create a new brand for their company, produce a digital billboard, direct and edit a television advertisement and design a metaverse, before pitching to Lord Sugar and industry experts at a black-tie event

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen meets the 2023 winner and runner-up, and is joined by special guests - including Lord Sugar via videolink - to look back over the past 12 weeks of the business-based reality show

programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Staffordshire, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Newcastle-under-Lyme to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Cameras observe Avon & Somerset police officers working the night-time shift. Plus, a North Wales PC talks about the difficulties faced as a minority in the force

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Kingston-upon-Hull to see a two-bedroom end-of-terrace bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Derby to see a three-storey Victorian house that has been split into two separate flats and in Gillingham, Kent, to check out a two-bedroom mid-terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts the latest contest in Leominster, Herefordshire, where Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri are helping the teams, and Christina learns about tribal art

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: nspector Finn and new detective Al attend the scene of a shooting - an event unheard of in sleepy Port Devine - after a bullet is fired through retired headmaster Eugene McManners' front door. Meanwhile, Marlene goes the extra mile for her best friend Nicole, alienating step-dad Barry in the process

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Stained glass expert Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window depicting a colourful boat at sea. Made by the owner's late father, it has a great deal of sentimental value. Meanwhile, leather expert Suzie Fletcher turns her attention to three iconic leather sling back Les Arcs chairs desperately in need of some love and attention to make them usable again. Plus, Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is in on a property trek around rural Shropshire, helping her house hunters with £425,000 to find a country home that they will hopefully fall in love with and buy. Margherita also delves into the county's industrial past with a trip to the Ironbridge Gorge, where she discovers the speed and skill needed to cut it as a clay pipe maker back in the 19th century

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell arrive in Northumberland on the last leg of their tour. Phil takes a punt on an antique pump for the second time before coming face to face with a scarecrow made in his own image. Irita takes a painterly turn, fancying a French work of art and goes back to school Pre-Raphaelite-style in the model village of Ford, where she follows in the footsteps of little-known artist Lady Louisa Waterford

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family members Elisha, Emma, Georgia and Paul compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: The One Show

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ashes-winning cricketer Steve Harmison, former Liverpool defender Stephen Warnock, snowboarding Winter Olympian Aimee Fuller and Rugby World Cup-winner Maggie Alphonsi join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reports of strange lights in the sky above North Farm lead ramblers to a newly appeared crop circle where they find an unidentified man's body. Humphrey finds himself at pains to suppress conspiracy theorists speculating alien involvement while methodically pursuing the case. Meanwhile, Martha's restaurant is reviewed by an influential food critic as she misses an important IVF appointment and makes an important decision regarding plans to start a family. Detective drama set in rural Devon, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control - a job in a pub just after he's promised his new girlfriend to stay off the booze. However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises there's more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love (1998)
programme.desc: The Elizabethan dramatist suffers from writer's block while working on his new play, and to make matters worse creditors are about to close down the theatre. But when a noblewoman disguises herself as a man to fulfil her dream of appearing on stage, the Bard becomes enchanted by her and is inspired to pen the most famous love story of all time. Comedy, with Joseph Fiennes, Gwyneth Paltrow, Judi Dench, Ben Affleck, Geoffrey Rush, Martin Clunes and Tom Wilkinson

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Jonathan Ross on Comic Books, Vick Hope on Pop Music, Gareth Thomas on Rugby, Victoria Derbyshire on News, Tom Allen on Gardening, Chunz on Maths, and Sara Cox on Dogs

programme.desc: Powerlifter Fiona tests her fellow travellers with a challenging 8.5km North Skye hike to Rubha Hunish, featuring epic cliff-top views

The hospital hosts its first ever Open Day but an emergency arises as the first visitors arrive

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: In the final instalment of their culinary journey through the history of British cuisine, Si King and Dave Myers explore comfort food, discussing how certain ingredients and recipes can give people a sense of well-being, such as chicken noodle soup and a simple fish dish

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Jordan Banjo and Chris Bavin head to Suffolk to advise a family divided at dinner time. Katy is acting mother to her late daughter's children, 10-year-old Ruby and eight-year-old Toby. All have very different tastes, which is a constant battle for Katy in her bid to unite them on single meals. Ruby eats most things but doesn't like fruit, whereas Toby does like fruit but hates vegetables. Katy herself has gluten and dairy intolerances. Chris and Jordan analyse the kitchen, replacing their usual choices with mainly cheaper brands disguised in plain packaging and also set a fruit and veg eating challenge

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin head to Japan, where they discover four extraordinary homes, built with great craftsmanship, combining high tech and a deep respect for tradition. Properties include the 'Glass House for a Diver' on the coast at Etajima, an all-glass building inspired by the chambers of an ants' nest, with rough concrete blocks chosen to surround the delicate home

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Dover Castle in Kent, Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis scour the crowd to find objects to take off to auction. Jonathan discovers an elegant Lalique figure and James finds a pristine collection of Chinese snuff bottles. Presenter Paul Martin uncovers the murderous history of the castle

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman reveal the secrets of farmers and food producers at the Peebles Show, where they discover tips and treats from passionate food producers, from perfect steaks to creating premium chocolate at a fraction of the price. Farmer Jim Smith is near Inverness discovering the story behind every bag of carrots and chef Julie Lin investigates what people are missing out on when it comes to mackerel

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliott compete to remodel a home in Gosport, Hampshire, that holds 20 years of family memories and a lifetime of antiques and heirlooms for soon-to-be grandparents Lisa and Judy. Angela Scanlon presents

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from the Central England region serve up their mains and desserts, competing for a place at a banquet celebrating animation and illustration. Their creative offerings include a Desperate Dan pie, a traditional Staffordshire stew, a homage to Zebedee from The Magic Roundabout, with a spring made of spun sugar, and a Bananaman dessert

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Leeds General Infirmary plastic surgeon Chris West's patients today include 67-year-old Trevor, who needs surgery to remove small bits of tumour left behind from a previous operation. But Trevor suffers from anxiety and the stress of waiting is making his condition worse, so before long he tries to leave. Meanwhile, neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on a tumour growing deep behind a patient's ear, which if not removed could paralyse her face

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon is persuaded to mark the occasion of his 40th birthday back at the Cockfield family home, so takes his girlfriend Donna along to the Isle of Wight. The duo soon find themselves spending a long weekend as guests of his ever-doting mother Sue and controlling stepfather Ray, together with their menagerie of relatives and friends. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Radioactive (2019)
programme.desc: Pole Marie Sklodowska emigrates to France where she meets and marries fellow scientist Pierre Curie, and they start to collaborate - resulting in them receiving a Nobel Prize. Growing doubts over the safety of radium casts a shadow over their research, but even after Pierre's death, Marie is determined to carry on. Biopic of Marie Curie, starring Rosamund Pike, with Sam Riley

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: The transformation of a beloved car leaves its owner astounded, and a pair of ballet shoes are given a new lease of life. Hosted by Sabrina Grant

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: A look at how one switch of the visa rules left many with their trips hanging in the balance, and the holidaymakers refused travel when their passports were perfectly valid. Plus, Simon Calder shares his best budget breaks

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Alan takes charge designing the first bedroom, but doubt soon sets in as Amanda and Scott struggle to get on board with his artistic vision. To nail his 'rustic chic' look, Alan visits interior designer Marie at her 300-year-old palazzo and ropes in Amanda to help source vintage gems at Palermo's famous flea market. Later, Amanda surprises Alan with a birthday boat trip along Sicily's stunning Zingaro coast

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Builder Garry has been learning to drive for 30 years and relied on wife Jeany to take him everywhere, but after she had an accident he now needs to pass to help her. Garry's battle is even tougher as his dyslexia makes following signs difficult, but Jeany is there with constant advice. During their five days at Scarlett's Driving School, there are near-misses on roundabouts and marital squabbles

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britain's fondness for picnics, preparing an alfresco lunch at Beaufort Polo Club in the Cotswolds. They also discover how the habit of outdoor dining in summer evolved into its current form, celebrate snacks such as Cornish pasties and Scotch eggs, and bake a Dundee cake

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Jordan Banjo and Chris Bavin head to Trowbridge, Wiltshire, to offer nutritional advice to Lucy-Kate and Leon, parents to eight-year-old Gabriel who has cerebral palsy. Lucy-Kate ensures Gabriel has a well-balanced diet filled with nutritious fruit and veg, but tends to neglect herself and Leon. Top of Chris's list is to help get the family eating together and he seeks Gabriel's help to make a tasty carbonara with Gabriel's favourite veg - broccoli. Jordan wants to help Lucy-Kate fall back in love with cooking and shows her a quick, easy, and nutritious meal the whole family can enjoy

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin explore four glamorous and beautifully designed homes in Florida. Properties include one of the largest homes to feature on the series, a waterfront plot in Miami's Indian Creek comprising two concrete block stacked at right angles and for sale at almost $30million. The duo also visit a self-build inspired by the modernists of the 1940s set in a lush jungle of a garden and a unique home comprising of three separate buildings raised on stilts

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Oxburgh Hall in Norfolk, Anita Manning discovers a Victorian dynamometer used for measuring the pressure of steam and David Harper is taken back to the days of ocean liners with a wine stopper from 1912. Presenter Paul Martin visits Cromer to find out about the RNLI's most decorated lifeboatman

Onkar Singh Purewal is in Cardiff to discover how setting up a food stall has provided a lifeline for some in the community, and in Ceredigion he discovers the key to making sourdough bread. Farmer Meinir Howells gets to grips with turning rapeseed into oil in Ruthin

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Damion Burrows and Lizzie Fraher compete to remodel Natasha and Gael's home in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex, which has a dark and claustrophobic downstairs layout that makes social gatherings impossible. Angela Scanlon presents

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the Central region go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. There are dishes celebrating The Dandy and computer game Pac-Man, and the guest judge is Duaa Karim, comedy actress and voice-over artist for children's animations

programme.title: Inside Taiwan: Standing up to China
programme.desc: Jane Corbin travels to Taiwan to take viewers inside a story that has ramifications for all of us. In the process, she reveals China's 'playbook' as its desire to 'reunify the motherland' becomes ever clearer, and it could drag the world into a dangerous confrontation

programme.desc: Frida and Diego travel to San Francisco where he has an important mural commission. Her style stirs much excitement, and Frida is determined to succeed in her own right in the face of Diego's affairs. Shocked by the vast gap between rich and poor that she witnesses in Depression-era New York, she struggles to hide her disdain for high society

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: The team investigate the shrink in the size of cabin luggage and which airlines are being the stingiest. Plus how a delayed flight could lead to the canceling of hire car bookings

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: Since sharing his own autism diagnosis with the world, naturalist and presenter Chris Packham has been flooded with messages from other autistic people, frustrated that their friends, families and colleagues don't understand them. In the first of two programmes, Chris sets out to bridge the gap, helping a group of people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal to their family and friends what is really going on inside their minds. They include comedian Flo from Wiltshire and 20-year-old student Murray from Oxfordshire - the son of Radio 2 DJ Ken Bruce

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explain how necessity often forced cooks to make the most of limited ingredients to create tasty dishes. They reveal that many popular meals were invented during hard times, from mince and dumplings to Scotch broths

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Jordan Banjo and Chris Bavin head to Manchester to meet Gaz and Amina White and their two young children. The couple both work in social services and juggling busy jobs means evenings in their house are a tale of two teatimes. Youngsters Lincoln and Elita get a delicious and nutritious home-cooked meal, whereas Gaz and Amina typically opt for pricey convenience food or takeaways. This lack of planning and reliance on expensive quick fixes is costing them time and money. Chris and Jordan try to encourage them to cook one meal for all and challenge all concerned to try new brands and new foods

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin explore bold and extraordinary homes in Spain, a country renowned for experimental and fearless architecture. They include a metal home in the foothills of the Pyrenees that is more like a piece of art, an architect's home in Madrid made of seven vast concrete and steel beams and a space-age circular building in the wilderness of Aragon

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts James Lewis and Jonathan Pratt assess items brought to Dover Castle in Kent, while presenter Paul Martin looks at the life of James Bond creator Ian Fleming

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge skills, and the winner of the week's games is announced

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman go in search of tips and treats at the York Food Festival, including homemade hummus and the many surprising varieties of the English apple. Baker Briony May Williams discovers how an app is reducing food waste and providing real bargains, and food journalist Leyla Kazim investigates how many people it takes to make a bag of crisps

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Will Foster compete to remodel a couple's 1950s home in Belfast, with Lei Ying dreaming of a perfect kitchen, while her husband David hopes for a cosy home and a safe route to the garden. Angela Scanlon presents

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty Don gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Cambridgeshire and reveals how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. And Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Dorset

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock the painter's world - after conducting a short affair with Leon Trotsky, Diego's political mentor, Frida finally achieves her own solo exhibition in Europe. But all does not go according to plan, and she returns to Mexico to find that Diego wants a divorce

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Philomena Cunk from Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe carries out in-depth investigations, travelling the length and breadth of the country and enlisting the help of a variety of experts. She begins by examining the origins of the universe, and interviews Robert Peston about British politics. Comedy documentary, starring Diane Morgan

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Eaten by Lions (2018)
programme.desc: When Pete and Omar lose their beloved grandmother, they go in search of Omar's estranged dad, confronting him on the day of his daughter's engagement party. Comedy, starring Antonio Aakeel, Jack Carroll (Britain's Got Talent) and Asim Chaudhry (People Just Do Nothing)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: With pressure mounting as he records his debut album, Dave has some decisions to make about what he is willing to sacrifice. Comedy, starring Dave Burd

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: The parole board considers the cases of two serious offenders. Fifteen years ago, Matthew violently murdered a young woman on a public street. A recently converted Christian, he now has the chance to move to an open prison where he will come into contact with the public. After being convicted for arson, 26-year-old Simran was caught dealing class A drugs. Halfway through his four-and-a-half year sentence, he has the chance to be released into the community. Will his history of mental health problems compromise this opportunity?

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the east of England in the inter-war period, starting in Canterbury, Kent, where he treads the boards as he uncovers the political message behind a 1936 play, inspired by the 12th-century murder of Archbishop Thomas a Becket. In Maidstone, he learns of the international origins of the most British symbol of remembrance. Outside Sevenoaks, Michael visits the country home of Winston Churchill, and discovers how the 1930s were wilderness years at Chartwell, as Churchill warned against Nazi appeasement. Once in the capital, he heads to Alexandra Palace, the birthplace of television

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist
programme.desc: Ben Robinson flies over Hadrian's Wall to reveal a new view of its history. The first full aerial survey of the construction has helped uncover new evidence about those who once resided there. Carried out over the past few years by English Heritage, it is allowing archaeologists to reinterpret the fortification as hundreds of sites of human occupation have been discovered, showing that people were living there in considerable numbers

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces animals that build structures and adapt the environment for their own benefit, creating safe places to sleep and raise young or traps to catch prey. The programme examines how the huge dams built by beavers can completely transform the surrounding landscape, the function of the different types of silk spiders are capable of producing, and how leafcutter ants build underground gardens where they farm their own food

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian explores the fate of the last three wives of Henry VIII. First, Lucy witnesses Henry's doomed courtship with Anne of Cleves, with Henry successfully reneging on their marriage having claimed it had yet to be consummated. Two weeks later, Henry married teenager Catherine Howard, but an act of adultery with a courtier saw the young woman convicted of treason and beheaded. Finally, Lucy explores Henry's relationship with his last wife Katherine Parr, and how she managed to win Henry round despite their greatly differing religious beliefs

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Henry is in agony with his ulcerated leg. The Duke of Norfolk presents his young and pretty niece Catherine Howard to the king, who becomes captivated. Henry soon marries Catherine - but will she prove to be his rose without a thorn? Keith Michell and Angela Pleasence star. From 1970

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: The year is 1543 and the king is grossly fat and semi-lame. Beset by boredom he longs for a new wife to ease his lonely life. Will the twice widowed and scholarly Katherine Parr fulfil his needs? Keith Michell and Rosalie Crutchley star in the historical drama. From 1970

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the east of England en route to Lincolnshire, discovering how the Crossrail project is helping to conserve birds and taking a gelato cart to Southend

programme.title: The Flying Archaeologist
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson flies over the Thames to make new discoveries about the First World War. A whole network of trenches has been discovered on the Hoo Peninsula. Invisible from the ground, they were found from aerial images of the area next to the former Chattenden Barracks

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: New discoveries from the edge of the solar system are transforming what is known about Pluto, thanks to the New Horizons space probe that took the first-ever close up images of the planet. Pluto was once thought to be geologically dead, but the pictures revealed it to be an active world of stunning complexity, with mountains carved from ice, a nitrogen glacier that appeared to be moving and a recently active volcano, with data sent back lead some scientists to speculate that there may even be life on Pluto today

programme.title: Victoria & Abdul (2017)
programme.desc: Adbul Karim is whisked from his clerk's job to present a ceremonial coin to Queen Victoria for her golden jubilee. The monarch, who is tired of her fawning courtiers, takes a liking to the young man and promotes him to become her Munshi, or spiritual teacher - much to the resentment of her family and household. Period drama, starring Judi Dench, Ali Fazal, Tim Pigott-Smith and Eddie Izzard

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins (2016)
programme.desc: A tone deaf socialite imagines she is a great singer, and her conniving yet devoted husband allows her to remain in her fantasy by holding concerts with small, invited audiences. However, reality threatens to intrude when she announces her intention of realising a lifelong dream of performing in New York's Carnegie Hall, recruiting a struggling young pianist to aid her. Fact-based comedy, starring Meryl Streep and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob joins director Stephen Frears on the Vienna set of forthcoming drama The Palace, and looks back his career while exploring the city. Frears looks back on his breakthrough in the theatre, at the Royal Court in London in the early 1960s, through BBC's Play for Today to his movie breakthrough with My Beautiful Laundrette and Dangerous Liaisons. With contributions from Hugh Grant, Judi Dench, Steve Coogan, Hanif Kureishi, Glenn Close, John Malkovich, Jack Black, Helen Mirren and Meryl Streep

The feature-length documentary, directed by Francis Whately, takes the audience on a musical journey through some of her greatest songs, including The Bridge, I Will Always Love You, and 9 To 5. Cameras also capture Dolly celebrating the 50th anniversary of her very first performance at the Grand Ole Opry, and features unprecedented access to the singer herself, as well as collaborators from throughout her career

programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: So you want to build the tallest building on Earth? Ambitious but good on yer! This episode will tell you how, starting with how not to. Most tall buildings are tall and thin because land is expensive. But this isn’t the best design because the lowest floor has to take the weight of all the floors above it. And so eventually, you reach a limit where the structure at the bottom isn’t strong enough. If you want to make a building significantly higher, then you need to change the shape and instead take inspiration from wedding cakes. The bottom layers of a wedding cake get wider and wider, which means that they can take more and more weight. In fact, the tallest building ever conceived, the X-Seed 4000, is 4km high and can house a million people - but it’s never been built. However, even if you made a giant cone-shaped building, and assuming you have materials that are strong enough, then eventually you would reach another limit, when the weight of the building is too much for the ground

programme.title: The Demon Headmaster
programme.desc: Kids discover their headmaster is using hypnotism to gain control of their school.

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Chelcea's biggest passion is for hair! In this documentary, she shows us how she does her hair at home, doing her own hair, her mum's hair, her sister's hair, her friend's hair and even her dad's beard. Shemhas been doing lots of different hairstyles for everyone, inlcuding twists, braids (thick and small), plaits, tops buns, and also leaving it out as an afro, which is really good for the hair and scalp. Chelcea is an expert on the science of hair and how to look after it, and is particularity interested in natural hair remedies. Chelcea's parents encourage their daughter's passion and, through beautiful animation, we learn about her mum's childhood in the Democratic Republic of Congo. By taking us on her own hair journey, Chelcea's determination to inspire others to celebrate their amazing hair shines through!

The What's in the Box? game reveals a wooden toy aeroplane, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are all inspired by an 'in the air' theme. This subject is explored through exploration, play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate 'in the air' object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about joining in with physical actions, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear are given a kite as a present. programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team re-examines the case of Suzanne Greenhill, a 20-year-old deaf woman from Newport. In 1988 Suzanne was found murdered at home, her body ghoulishly staged to represent the cover of an Iron Maiden heavy metal album cover. Detectives had to work closely with the deaf community to uncover the identity of Suzanne's killer, with pioneering forensic techniques called upon to secure a conviction. It has gone down in history as one of the most unique murder investigations in policing history

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Radio DJ and trucking enthusiast Jagger is put through his paces by instructor Will as he prepares for his Class 1 HGV test. Newly qualified driver Laura may have her HGV test behind her, but she still has challenges to overcome. Today she faces her nemesis - the most complex intersection on the British road system, serving 18 routes on five different levels, otherwise known as Spaghetti Junction

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reports of strange lights in the sky above North Farm lead ramblers to a newly appeared crop circle where they find an unidentified man's body. Humphrey finds himself at pains to suppress conspiracy theorists speculating alien involvement while methodically pursuing the case. Meanwhile, Martha's restaurant is reviewed by an influential food critic as she misses an important IVF appointment and makes an important decision regarding plans to start a family. Detective drama set in rural Devon, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A celebration of one of football's most talented players, from his early days as a promising young prospect to his rise to fame with Tottenham and his record-breaking transfer to Real Madrid. This documentary offers and inside look into his life and career

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control - a job in a pub just after he's promised his new girlfriend to stay off the booze. However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises there's more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love (1998)
programme.desc: The Elizabethan dramatist suffers from writer's block while working on his new play, and to make matters worse creditors are about to close down the theatre. Comedy, with Joseph Fiennes, Gwyneth Paltrow, Judi Dench, Ben Affleck, Geoffrey Rush, Martin Clunes and Tom Wilkinson

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. programme.desc: In Birmingham, Dion Dublin struggles to find the promised potential in a three-bedroom end-of-terrace - until he discovers a huge surprise outside. Martel Maxwell is in Warrington, Cheshire, looking around the bare and broken shell of a cottage in need of complete renovation. Plus, cameras return to the Staffordshire countryside to see how things turned out for a young couple renovating a two-bedroom cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Oswestry Showground in Shropshire, with experts Kate Bliss and Ben Cooper. Before the reds and blues' chosen items go under the hammer, Charles Hanson auctions off a rare Chinese treasure that was discovered inside a carrier bag on its way to a charity shop

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel gets exciting news from an old friend, but discovers something unpleasant in the process. Medical drama series set in a busy Midlands surgery

programme.title: Jay and Dom's Home Fix
programme.desc: An old trunk is turned into a cocktail cabinet, Diarmuid Gavin creates a garden retreat complete with firepit, and a 50p charity shop cup makes an extraordinary return at auction

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is in rural Herefordshire with a couple who want to escape life from under Stansted's flight path and invest their £600,000 in a country home with space for a beloved car and a large coffee table. Jonnie also drops in on the Hay Festival and finds out what attracts a worldwide audience to this quiet Welsh borders area every year

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell tour Co Durham, where after three defeats Phil is desperate to secure a win. He tries to shape up by pumping iron in the form of a water feature, while Irita goes clubbing - Edwardian-style. Phil also has a bash at organ restoration and Irita takes a trip back to the heyday of British seaside holidays at Whitley Bay's Spanish City

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Bob, Andrew, Frank and Fiona compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Jermaine Jenas and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things get worse for Jack and Denise and Stacey turns to Alfie for help with her financial situation. Rocky is rattled when Kathy finds a wedding dress and Patrick announces he's going to win back Yolande

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A wizard-inspired pair think magical drinks and mini golf will cast a spell over Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. A nervous entrepreneur promotes an all-natural supplement that promises glowing skin from within, while there's a sweet pitch from chocolate-makers who have apparently spotted a gap in the market. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The finalists take on their last challenge to win a £250,000 investment, with contestants ejected earlier in the series returning to aid them in their endeavours. The last two must launch their business, create a new brand for their company, produce a digital billboard, direct and edit a television advertisement and design a metaverse, before pitching to Lord Sugar and industry experts at a black-tie event

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen meets the 2023 winner and runner-up, and is joined by special guests - including Lord Sugar via videolink - to look back over the past 12 weeks of the business-based reality show

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Staffordshire, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Newcastle-under-Lyme to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerly appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Cameras observe Avon & Somerset police officers working the night-time shift. Plus, a North Wales PC talks about the difficulties faced as a minority in the force

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Kingston-upon-Hull to see a two-bedroom end-of-terrace bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Derby to see a three-storey Victorian house that has been split into two separate flats and in Gillingham, Kent, to check out a two-bedroom mid-terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts the latest contest in Leominster, Herefordshire, where Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri are helping the teams, and Christina learns about tribal art

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: nspector Finn and new detective Al attend the scene of a shooting - an event unheard of in sleepy Port Devine - after a bullet is fired through retired headmaster Eugene McManners' front door. Meanwhile, Marlene goes the extra mile for her best friend Nicole, alienating step-dad Barry in the process

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Stained glass expert Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window depicting a colourful boat at sea. Made by the owner's late father, it has a great deal of sentimental value. Meanwhile, leather expert Suzie Fletcher turns her attention to three iconic leather sling back Les Arcs chairs desperately in need of some love and attention to make them usable again. Plus, Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is in on a property trek around rural Shropshire, helping her house hunters with £425,000 to find a country home that they will hopefully fall in love with and buy. Margherita also delves into the county's industrial past with a trip to the Ironbridge Gorge, where she discovers the speed and skill needed to cut it as a clay pipe maker back in the 19th century

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell arrive in Northumberland on the last leg of their tour. Phil takes a punt on an antique pump for the second time before coming face to face with a scarecrow made in his own image. Irita takes a painterly turn, fancying a French work of art and goes back to school Pre-Raphaelite-style in the model village of Ford, where she follows in the footsteps of little-known artist Lady Louisa Waterford

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family members Elisha, Emma, Georgia and Paul compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Social Democratic and Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas chat to studio guests, while a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: Farm to Feast: Best Menu Wins
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes returns with the cookery competition in which seven amateur cooks move into a castle in Fermanagh, where they live with and compete against each other. The first round begins with a reveal of two key ingredients - the distinctive Bramley apple from Armagh and award-winning Dexter beef from Co Down. From these, the contestants must create a menu for one small and one large dish. Michelin star chef Danni Barry and food critic Joris Minne blind select their favourite three menus - determining the three cooks who will battle it out in the kitchen for a place in the semi-final

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reports of strange lights in the sky above North Farm lead ramblers to a newly appeared crop circle where they find an unidentified man's body. Humphrey finds himself at pains to suppress conspiracy theorists speculating alien involvement while methodically pursuing the case. Meanwhile, Martha's restaurant is reviewed by an influential food critic as she misses an important IVF appointment and makes an important decision regarding plans to start a family. Detective drama set in rural Devon, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control - a job in a pub just after he's promised his new girlfriend to stay off the booze. However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises there's more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Keepin' 'Er Country: On the Road Again
programme.desc: Documentary featuring Irish country music stars as they go out on tour in the wake of the pandemic. The opening programme focuses on Derek Ryan and Lisa McHugh as they get ready to take to the stage for the annual Farmers' Bash - a sold-out show at a major venue. Derek is one of the biggest names on the country music scene and his string of hits and number one albums means he is a massive draw for fans of all ages. Lisa raised her new-born son during the cessation of live music, but is now getting used to uggling childcare and her touring schedule

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ashes-winning cricketer Steve Harmison, former Liverpool defender Stephen Warnock, snowboarding Winter Olympian Aimee Fuller and Rugby World Cup-winner Maggie Alphonsi join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim is invited to parliament to take part in a Select Committee for the new disability funding act, but when Lily shows up and gets him thrown out, he swears revenge. Idris' mum visits to keep an eye on his new business venture but she turns out to be an alt-right conspiracy theorist who sets out on a crusade to turn his bookshop into a temple of bigotry

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Lily's latest scam is at risk when Tim runs into his nemesis Kiefer. Idris is roped into keeping the scam alive but is slowly broken down by Aaliyah's doom and Ruth's insults leading him to embrace the darkness. Can Tim save the day?

programme.title: Barra on the Foyle
programme.desc: Barra Best makes a journey across the river network, meeting people who work, live and play along its banks,and exploring places and landscapes rarely seen on TV screens

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Jonathan Ross on Comic Books, Vick Hope on Pop Music, Gareth Thomas on Rugby, Victoria Derbyshire on News, Tom Allen on Gardening, Chunz on Maths, and Sara Cox on Dogs

programme.desc: Statement from the home secretary Suella Braverman on the Casey Review of the culture and standards of the Metropolitan Police following the murder of Sarah Everard by a serving police officer.

programme.desc: Live coverage of the Transport select committee session on minimum service levels for rail with evidence from Phil Smart, Assistant Policy Manager at the Rail Freight Group, Kate Nicholls, Chief Executive Officer of UK Hospitality and Anthony Smith, Chief Executive of Transport Focus.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Heathrow readies itself for a flurry of passengers as it's announced that holidaymakers can travel to 12 new countries. To keep Britain safe - and to keep it as simple for passengers as possible - a new traffic light system has come into operation, dividing Heathrow's 206 destinations into colours. Passenger Service Manager Demi is tasked with helping the many confused passengers, including one very agitated granny-to-be who has been turned away from her flight and isn't going quietly. programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mr. Brick has decided to cook some of the lovely childhood meals his mother used to make, and share them with the kids at school. In order to avoid eating these culinary horrors, Sam and Mo ask the Spectral Scepter for the power to produce any food of their choice. However, their half-power turns everything they touch into vegetables! Which gets Sam in a real pickle when she convinces herself that, as a result of that power, she has turned Stella into a carrot!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam decides to do her 3-day-workplace-discovery internship with her father, Percy, with hopes of sending the first PDRA into space: Hammy. Mo, on the other hand, hasn't even looked for an internship, utterly convinced that his father will give him one in Town Hall, on the day itself. Unfortunately, JC beat him to the punch and since Mr. Brick has strictly prohibited two internships at the same place, Mo winds up with none at all!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd and Abacus are on the hunt for a nice quiet spot to play their favourite board game - the trouble is that everywhere is either too loud, too busy, or too dangerous! They finally find the perfect place... but then they forget to take gravity into account.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd has an unexpected windfall of crumbs and sets out to buy happiness, cleaning the newsstand out of comics, dining at the Pancake, and hiring his friends to carry his lovely crumbs around - however, he soon learns that crumbs can't buy true happiness.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Lil Sue has started a delivery company called Deliver Sue, and in a quest to raise money for a new set of wheels, Dave lands himself with a job - Anna thinks she knows how to deliver packages quicker than Dave, though, and a dramatic sibling rivalry soon unfolds.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave is thrilled when he wins an electronic home help device called Barry - finally, his family can boss something around other than him, but it is not long before Barry is overwhelmed by the Spuds' demands. Fighting back, Barry takes over Grimsby Heights and heads off to the sea for some well-earned peace and quiet.

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: A game of Extreme Hide and Seek in Auto Tunes causes a junkslide which unearths a still-functional music box.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby and the gang accept an invitation from famous actor Malcolm McDowell to take an exploratory trip through time, they find themselves actually traveling into the future.

programme.title: Tata and Kuma
programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Kuma is enjoying a bath in the bathroom, but suddenly he recognises that he is floating in the middle of the Pacific Ocean in a bathtub. Sea gulls are flying around and fish-shaped buns are swimming in the sea with lollipop corals and candy-shaped fish.. Where is this place? Suddenly, a shark starts to chase after Kuma, whose adventure begins in this amazing sea.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Animated comedy following the adventures of Craig and his two friends Kelsey and JP. When Craig accidentally destroys Kit's entire supply of red velvet Chocorolls, he has to pay her back by making trades for her throughout the day. He must first sell some lame headgear, then get a certain sour snack from the Ninja Kids for the Elders, and finally get a very bland granola bar from the Junk Lord... or rather, his wild junk cats.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Animated comedy following the adventures of Craig and his two friends Kelsey and JP. The Stump Kids head over to the Elder Rock to ask the Elders something, only to discover that they have been trapped underneath their rock for five days after their support gave way. Not wanting their parents to come, Craig and Kelsey try to free them while JP fills in at Mark's job - meanwhile, the Elders livestream their struggle as Creek Kids from all over watch on.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Our heroes are on the run after escaping from the Lady Bone Demon - they need to track down a powerful weapon to beat her, but the Macaque has other plans.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The heroes are captured by the Dragon of the East - Mei's distant uncle - and it's up to Mei to save her friends before the Macaque catches up.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A heavy metal extraction platform carrying toxic waste at the bottom of the ocean experiences a devastating fire. Gordon rushes in with Thunderbird 4 when the rolling factory damages its steering capabilities. With the help of Lady Penelope and Parker on the surface investigating the dealings of dubious executive Hector Ambrose, boss of the company Hydrexla, Gordon sets about rescuing platform operator Ned Tedford and his plant Gladys and prevent the rig from losing its toxic cargo

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: Jim and Flower throw a dinner party to impress Jim's boss. When the dessert goes missing Overlord becomes the prime suspect

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Frankie, frustrated by her family's boredom with her scientific endeavours, is happy about the arrival of a mega-intelligent couple at the hotel

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: Comedy arts and crafts show presented by comedian Bec Hill. programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam and Mo are at the end of their tether - Amber, who happens to be their neighbour, wakes them up every morning singing her salutation to the sun. When she bursts into song in the middle of the night and prevents any sleep, Mo and Sam break down and together invoke the power to control people's voices!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. He is in despair, but Sam is delighted - thanks to her squirrel ears, she gains the trust of animals and enjoys magical experiences in the park!

programme.desc: With autumn well on its way, much of the wildlife in Dalby and Cropton Forests prepare for a new season and all that it brings. Over at the beaver pond, ecologist Cath is keeping a close eye on the family, as the older siblings begin to show signs of causing conflict in the wider group. programme.title: Tyrant: The Rise of Adolf Hitler
programme.desc: A radical re-telling of the events that lead to the Second World War, this time focusing on the period between September 1938 and March 1939. In September 1938, Hitler makes his intention to invade Czechoslovakia known, but Britain and France make it clear they will go to war against Germany if he does so. On the night of 9 November in Germany, Nazi forces attack Jewish property and homes, killing many Jews and arresting thousands more. Known as Kristallnacht, this was the start of the Holocaust, which exposed Hitler and his horrific plans on the world stage. Finally, this episode travels back to 15 March 1939, when Hitler's troops marched across the border and occupied Czechoslovakia

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: The documentary series turns attention to events in London in April, 1980, when six armed men from Iran seized control of the capital's Iranian embassy. Holding 26 people at gunpoint, the terrorists demanded the immediate release of political prisoners incarcerated in their homeland, and safe passage from the UK. If these demands were not met, the men claimed they would shoot all 26 of their hostages. Forty years later, first-hand accounts from some of the hostages, interviews with John Dellow of the Metropolitan Police and Gen Michael Rose of the SAS, and recorded footage from the incident are all brought together to provide an insight into the six-day ordeal that ended in a dramatic rescue operation

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell sets out on a journey to discover how six of Britain's most stunning bridges were designed and built. Completed in 1890, the Forth Rail Bridge now carries around 200 trains every day. The last of the great Victorian engineering triumphs, it has grown to symbolise Scotland as much as Edinburgh Castle, bagpipes or kilts. But, as Rob learns, this incredible engineering achievement was born from the tragedy of the 1879 Tay Bridge disaster, and 73 deaths were connected with its construction and immediate aftermath

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men (1955)
programme.desc: A law-abiding Arizona rancher runs into trouble when he unwittingly makes an enemy of a neighbouring landowner, who resents him for having befriended and comforted his abused mistress. The jealous man then recruits nine gunmen in a bid to drive his rival out of the territory. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Donna Martell and Jocelyn Brando

programme.title: Wake of the Red Witch (1948)
programme.desc: A ship owner and his embittered captain engage in a battle of wills as they fight for the love of the same woman and embark on a quest for a treasure chest of pearls hidden in the den of an octopus in the South Seas. Romantic seafaring adventure, starring John Wayne, Luther Adler, Gig Young, Gail Russell and Adele Mara

programme.title: Dragoon Wells Massacre (1957)
programme.desc: A cavalry officer is assigned to escort a captured murderer to prison. However, the prisoner and his guard are compelled to join forces to survive when Apache warriors raid their wagon train as it moves across Arizona into hostile territory. Western, starring Barry Sullivan, Dennis O'Keefe, Mona Freeman and Katy Jurado

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: Bumblebee (2018)
programme.desc: In 1987, Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father, while her mother Sally and new boyfriend Ron leaves her feeling even more alone. For her 18th-birthday she's given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: Titanic (1997)
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton

programme.title: Elle (2016)
programme.desc: After being raped in her home by a masked assailant, Michèle Leblanc does not go to the police as she has far too many other things to concern herself with to put her life on hold. But when Michèle starts getting text messages from the rapist describing her clothing and whereabouts, she arms herself with pepper spray and a small axe, considering all the men in her life a possible suspect. Paul Verhoeven's thriller, starring Isabelle Huppert. In French

programme.title: Elephant Walk (1954)
programme.desc: A woman struggles to come to terms with her tea plantation owner husband's obsession with his dead father. Melodrama, starring Elizabeth Taylor, Peter Finch, Dana Andrews and Abraham Sofaer

programme.title: Decision at Sundown (1957)
programme.desc: A gunslinger rides into a backwoods town intent on finding his dead wife's former lover and exacting revenge for her death. The man he blames now has total control of the town and has the sheriff at his beck and call. Undeterred, the drifter offers his enemy an ultimatum - he has until sundown to leave the town or face retribution for his crimes. Western, with Randolph Scott, John Carroll and Andrew Duggan

programme.title: The Court-Martial of Billy Mitchell (1955)
programme.desc: In the 1920s, an American colonel accuses the war department of criminal negligence for denying the air force the funding it needs - but the powers-that-be still regard aircraft as an irrelevant part of the military, and respond by putting him on trial. Courtroom drama, starring Gary Cooper and Rod Steiger, with Ralph Bellamy and Elizabeth Montgomery

programme.title: Cat Ballou (1965)
programme.desc: A schoolteacher returns to her home town to find a ruthless railroad developer is trying to snatch her family's land. When her father is murdered by a hitman for refusing to sell his ranch, she resolves to defend the property, enlisting the aid of two small-time crooks and a drunken gunslinger with an equally inebriated horse. Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye

programme.title: Finding Your Feet (2017)
programme.desc: A wealthy woman's privileged existence is shattered when she discovers her husband is having an affair with her best friend. Seeking solace, she turns to her estranged sister, who lives in a London council estate, and finds a new lease of life in joining her community dance class. Comedy, starring Imelda Staunton, Celia Imrie, Timothy Spall and Joanna Lumley

programme.title: Cast Away (2000)
programme.desc: A manager for an American courier service has to fend for himself when a plane crash leaves him stranded alone on a desert island. Initially panic-stricken, he overcomes his terror to survive for four years on his own before building a raft and setting off on an epic journey back home. Adventure drama, starring Tom Hanks, Helen Hunt, Nick Searcy, Lari White and Chris Noth

programme.title: xXx: The Return of Xander Cage (2017)
programme.desc: The extreme sports-loving super spy is brought out of exile when a lethal gang of mercenaries steal a powerful new weapon that threatens the safety of the entire world. He must assemble his own team of adrenaline junkie agents to recover the lethal device. Action thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Donnie Yen, Toni Collette and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Eagle vs Shark (2006)
programme.desc: Lily, a painfully shy burger bar employee, nurses an unrequited crush on self-obsessed video game addict Jarrod. Romance finally seems to blossom between the unlikely pair at a fancy dress party, but Lily ends up being drawn into Jarrod's obsessive quest to exact revenge on the school bully who made his teenage years a misery. Taika's Waititi's quirky comedy, starring Loren Horsley and Jemaine Clement

programme.title: The Holly and the Ivy (1952)
programme.desc: A country parson's life is changed dramatically by a series of revelations at a Christmas family reunion. Drama, starring Ralph Richardson and Celia Johnson

programme.title: Detective Story (1951)
programme.desc: A moralistic New York cop is determined to ensure the conviction of an illegal abortionist implicated in the deaths of several women. However, his obsession leads him to lose control, and he is disturbed to discover his own wife was once one of the doctor's patients - a secret she had kept from him. Police drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Eleanor Parker and William Bendix

programme.title: Pimpernel Smith (1941)
programme.desc: An unassuming English professor working on an archaeological dig in Germany leads a double life helping enemies of the Nazi regime escape the country. Second World War adventure based on The Scarlet Pimpernel, directed by and starring Leslie Howard, with Francis L Sullivan, Mary Morris, Hugh McDermott, Raymond Huntley and Manning Whiley

programme.title: Hangman's Knot (1952)
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning

programme.title: I, Robot (2004)
programme.desc: The inventor of an advanced form of intelligent robot is found dead, and the detective investigating the case is certain that one of the scientist's mechanical creations is responsible - but no one believes his theory because the robots have been programmed to prevent them from harming humans. Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk

programme.title: A Vigilante (2019)
programme.desc: After escaping her violent husband, a woman makes it her life's mission to help free others in danger. Drama, starring Olivia Wilde and Morgan Spector

programme.title: The Hunt (2019)
programme.desc: A group of elites gather for the first time at a remote manor house to hunt ordinary Americans for sport. However, the elites' master plan is about to be derailed because one of the hunted, Crystal, knows the hunters' game better than they do, and turns the tables on the killers as she makes her way toward the mysterious woman at the centre of the mystery. Director Craig Zobel's horror thriller, starring Betty Gilpin, Hilary Swank and Emma Roberts

programme.title: Free Fire (2016)
programme.desc: It is 1978 and two Irish terrorists are in Boston to buy a shipment of assault rifles from a South African arms dealer, backed-up by hired muscle to help with a deal brokered by a woman and her psychopathic colleague. The deal takes place in a rundown warehouse and it is not long before a minor altercation gets out of hand and bullets start flying in every direction. Ben Wheatley's comedy crime drama, starring Cillian Murphy, Brie Larson, Sharlto Copley and Armie Hammer

programme.title: In Fear (2013)
programme.desc: A couple go to Ireland for a music festival, but get hopelessly lost when driving through a series of country roads. Their plight turns deadly as they are terrorised by mysterious figures lurking in the darkness, while an encounter with a seemingly harmless local brings dangers of its own. Horror, starring Iain De Caestecker, Alice Englert and Allen Leech
